value.title: Pony.ai raises $100 million more to advance its autonomous vehicle tech
value.excerpt: Autonomous vehicle startup Pony.ai has raised $100 million more, bringing its total raised to over $1 billion at a $5.3 billion valuation.

value.title: Why do financial services need AI?
value.excerpt: For financial institutions, recovering from the pandemic will end tentative experiments with artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) and demand their large-scale adoption. The crisis has required financial organisations to respond to customer needs around the clock.

value.title: Qualcomm research could lower the barriers to visual AI everywhere
value.excerpt: Qualcomm is working to reduce the compute power needed for visual AI to enable chips that are smaller, cheaper, and less power hungry.

value.title: Delta expanding facial recognition technology to domestic flights in Detroit
value.excerpt: Delta Air Lines is bringing facial recognition technology to domestic flights. Last week, the airline announced that it is launching its digital ID technology for domestic flights out of Detroit Metropolitan Wayne County Airport.

value.title: AIOps And The Quest For The Grail
value.excerpt: For those unfamiliar with the term, AIOps simply means applying machine learning to IT operations functions. But implementing AIOps into a complex environment requires patience and a carefully planned strategy.

value.title: Former CIOs Discuss What It Takes to Be a Startup CEO
value.excerpt: A new generation of business software startups is taking shape, in some cases with former CIOs serving as founders and chief executives.

value.title: Serbia And Key International Sovereigns Lead With Data And AI To Become Vaccination Champions
value.excerpt: By leveraging the power of advanced technologies and artificial intelligence, nations like Serbia, Greece, the UAE and Israel have been able to set up an optimized and effective vaccine distribution framework.

value.title: Puppy training a robotic dog points to the future
value.excerpt: But don't rush to call the animal welfare authorities - it's a robotic dog undergoing training at Edinburgh University. Alex Li is the Head of the Advanced Robotics Lab at the university and is among those leading the way in applying artificial intelligence (AI) to robotics.

value.title: AI Weekly: What Andy Jassy’s ascension to CEO means for Amazon’s AI initiatives
value.excerpt: VentureBeat examines how Andy Jassy's ascention to Amazon CEO could impact the company's AI initiatives and sales of facial recognition tech.

value.title: Amazon DevOps Guru is powered by pre-trained ML models that encode operational excellence
value.excerpt: On December 1, 2020, we announced the preview of Amazon DevOps Guru, a machine learning (ML)-powered service that gives operators of cloud-based applications a simpler way to measure and improve an application’s operational performance and availability to reduce expensive downtime. value.title: ‘Orwellian’ AI lie detector project challenged in EU court
value.excerpt: A legal challenge was heard today in Europe’s Court of Justice in relation to a controversial EU-funded research project using artificial intelligence for facial ‘lie detection’ with the aim of speeding up immigration checks.

value.title: Ukuma Ta'ai: Newcastle Thunder sign ex-Huddersfield Giants back-rower
value.excerpt: Newcastle Thunder have signed former Huddersfield Giants back-rower Ukuma Ta'ai for the 2021 season. Ta'ai spent seven years at the Giants following his move from New Zealand Warriors in the National Rugby League,

value.title: Using Artificial Intelligence to prevent harm caused by immunotherapy
value.excerpt: Until recently, researchers and oncologists had placed lung cancer patients into two broad categories: those who would benefit from immunotherapy, and those who likely would not. Now, researchers, using artificial intelligence (AI) to analyze simple tissue scans,

value.title: Anomaly detection with Amazon Lookout for Metrics
value.excerpt: This is a guest blog post from Quantiphi, an AWS Advanced Consulting Partner that specializes in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and data and analytics solutions. value.title: 3 No-Brainer Stocks to Buy in Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: In fiction, artificial intelligence is often associated with intelligent androids or dystopian futures. But in reality, the AI market mainly revolves around crunching large amounts of data to make quick decisions.

value.title: Unlocking iPhones While Wearing a Face Mask: Now Easier, If You Have iOS 14.5—and an Apple Watch
value.excerpt: Apple’s next iOS software updates—iOS 14.5—includes a feature we have all been waiting for: the ability to unlock an iPhone with Face ID while wearing a mask. The catch? You need an Apple Watch.

value.title: Rev Announces New Languages in Automated Speech Recognition
value.excerpt: The world’s most accurate speech-to-text engine, Rev, today announced the expansion of its highly accurate speech recognition service with the addition of four new languages: French, German, Portuguese,

value.title: First Trust’s ROBT ETF: A Hidden Gem for the Rise of Robotics
value.excerpt: Enter exchange traded funds like the First Trust Nasdaq Artificial Intelligence and Robotics ETF (NasdaqGM: ROBT). ROBT follows the Nasdaq CTA Artificial Intelligence and Robotics Index. ROBT provides exposure to target companies engaged in the artificial intelligence and robotics segments of the technology,

value.title: Robot Motherships To Launch Drone Swarms From Sea, Underwater, Air And Near-Space
value.excerpt: Metal Shark's unmanned vessel is just one of a series of new launch platforms able to deliver swarms of attack drones -- swarm-equipped boats, unmanned submarines, unmanned jets and stratospheric balloons are all on the way.

value.title: Three ways artificial intelligence could change the markets
value.excerpt: AI is reshaping certain businesses faster than others — in particular, transport, healthcare and the digital landscape are in for an overhaul.

value.title: Google engineers quit after the company fired its star AI ethics researcher
value.excerpt: Two Google engineers have quit over the firing of AI researcher Timnit Gebru, whose exit sparked an internal backlash about ethics and diversity.

value.title: Humanoid robots and how we're failing at human relationships
value.excerpt: Hanson Robotics didn’t make Sophia just because they could. They’re capitalizing on something in our culture that needs to be recognized. We’re failing each other.

value.title: We Need To Talk About An Energy Label For AI
value.excerpt: Could this phenomenon inspire us to develop more energy-efficient AI systems? Our computational power has risen exponentially, enabling the widespread use of artificial intelligence, a technology that relies on processing huge amounts of data to recognize patterns.

value.title: Three Ways AI Can Help You Evolve Your Digital Marketing Strategy
value.excerpt: The main reason businesses use AI is for data collection. Instead of manually going through every customer interaction, businesses can use AI programs to compile this information into actionable reports.
